intro: Cerefolium, commonly known as white hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its basal leaves that are typically palmately lobed and its showy, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and meadows. Cerefolium species are known for their toxic properties, containing various alkaloids that can be harmful to humans and animals.
